Html:
Hi guys,
I am new to 837/835 parser builder.

I have two questions
  1. Can OopFactory provide support for building 835 Claim Payment/Advice file?
  2. Can we build 387 file from ClaimDocument Object?
    Using below code we can parse 837 file into ClaimDocument Object.
  FileStream my837File = new FileStream(AppDomain.CurrentDomain.BaseDirectory + "..\\..\\TestFile\\837.txt", FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read);
                //X12Parser parser = new X12Parser();

                ClaimTransformationService claimTransformationService =
                new ClaimTransformationService();
                
                ClaimDocument claimDocument = claimTransformationService.Transform837ToClaimDocument(my837File);
Same way can we build 387 file from ClaimDocument Object?

Question 1 - Yes
Question 2 - No

However you can create your own function to do that. You have to be good in xslt.
